N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2208.1 - Eligibility

State Regulations

In addition to the eligibility criteria set forth in
section
145-6.2
(a) of this

Title, in order to receive payment of an award under this Part a recipient
shall comply with the following: (a) Citizenship. A recipient must, at the time of receipt of his or her first
payment under this Part, (1) be a citizen of the United States, or (2) be an
alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence in the United States, or (3) be
an individual of a class of refugees paroled by the Attorney General of the

United States under his parole authority pertaining to the admission of aliens
to the United States. (b) Residency. A recipient must, at the time of receipt of his or her first payment
under this Part be a resident of the State of New York. (c) Default on prior obligation. Except as
provided herein, any recipient who is in default in the repayment of any
student loan, the payment of which has been guaranteed by the corporation
pursuant to the provisions of Education Law, section 680, or any recipient who
has failed to comply with the terms of any service condition imposed by an
academic performance award or any recipient who has failed to repay an award as
required by Education Law, section 665(4)(a) shall not be eligible for payment
of an award under this section, so long as such default status or failure to
comply or repay continues. A recipient, however, shall be eligible to receive
payment of the award if such recipient fulfills the conditions set forth in

Education Law, section 661(6)(c) and Part 2008 of this Title or agrees to
assign the award payments to the corporation toward payment of the amount due
on the defaulted loan or other outstanding obligation. Notes
